text: About the teaching.. you can always become a teacher even in psychology after years, if you do a phd later on you could teach at universities so this option does not disappear from the picture..

Uni is not scary...especially in the first year you'll see it's made that way so students are supported and things are kept in a basic manner so they keep up and adjust..Also, you would never feel alone as everyone will be there to help, from tutors to other students and groups :smile: I think it's a positive experience in general that helps you grow and discover more things

about the competition in the field...you're right, that happens everywhere but no one will ever be you, so you have a special place for yourself whatever you choose to do, because you will always have your own specific and different input in whatever you do :relaxed:

I also like to look at it that way, when you need to go at the top of a ladder, the only thing you need to do next is to focus on the next step infront of you and then from that step to the next one.. and in the end step by step you will get to the top but only after focusing on one step at a time, otherwise it can feel overwhelming..

From my experience, imagine when i was 18 (now I am 27) and went to uni to study business management (that was not at all what i wanted but I thought i'll do it because it's something you could expand on many things later on).. after 3 years of the degree I learned so much more about my self and what I wanted to do so after that I directed and changed my focus towards a different route.. (psychology)
I would have never imagined when I was 18 that this would happen like that, but time and experiences led me by themselves where i wanted to be
In your case you do have this interest in psychology already which is very nice to use as a base and then from there you could start and see where it will take you :smile:
Do you have a rough idea o Unis you'd like to apply to?

Wow that was very helpful, thank you so much! Yeah i was looking into st georges university, staffordshire university, and kingston university. Im not 100% sure which uni i would want to go to but thats the rough idea. Also what is clearing?
An other idea would be to maybe visit some of the unis you want to go just to get the feel of the campus and the buildings even the area around etc and try and see how you'd feel being there..

I know how overwhelming it can be to decide your future at this age because sometimes you don't feel like you have all the information needed to make such decisions, but you will figure it out as you go :relaxed:
Clearing is basically when you apply late for a place at uni, around July-August-September before the course starts and applies to fill places that are yet to be filled
so basically is last minute entries in a way
Also, you mentioned you have some concerns about the personal statement..when do you have to give this in approximately?

Yeah sounds like a good idea! I was supposed to go to the st georges open day this saturday however im work on the weekends which is unfortunate so i couldnt go :slightly_frowning_face:. Oh okay, i never really understood clearing thanks for summing it up for me. So our head of sixth form has set a deadline for our personal statement drafts to be given on the 15th of october, and im struggling to start it.
Also im not quite sure what to add in it, every wednesday mornings we get time to work on our personal statements with our form teacher and ive gotten an idea of how to structure it.
